children.content: Intervention

children.node: Exposed individual hepatitis B immune
children.content: Determine if the exposed individual is immune to Hepatitis B

children.node: No PEP warranted
children.content: No post-exposure prophylaxis is warranted

children.content: Determine if the exposed individual is nonimmune to Hepatitis B or a vaccine nonresponder after 1 series

children.content: Administer Hepatitis B post-exposure prophylaxis for a high-risk event

children.node: Hepatitis B PEP for high-risk event

children.content: Determine if there was Hepatitis C exposure, regardless of risk level

children.node: No PEP (currently available agents of no proven benefit)
children.content: No post-exposure prophylaxis is recommended as currently available agents have no proven benefit

children.node: D
children.content: Follow-up of exposed individual

children.node: Source hepatitis B positive or unknown but from high-risk group and exposed nonimmune
children.content: The source is Hepatitis B positive or from a high-risk group, and the exposed individual is nonimmune

children.node: Repeat hepatitis B panel at 4 wk, 3 mo, and 6 mo
children.content: Repeat Hepatitis B panel at 4 weeks, 3 months, and 6 months. No follow-up testing required for hepatitis B if exposed has documented immunity

children.node: Source hepatitis C positive or unknown but from high-risk group
children.content: The source is Hepatitis C positive or from a high-risk group

children.node: Hepatitis C antibody at 4 wk, 3 mo, and 6 mo
children.content: Test for Hepatitis C antibody at 4 weeks, 3 months, and 6 months. Consider hepatitis C RNA testing at 4 wk. For hepatitis C seroconversion, early referral to specialist is recommended

children.node: Source hepatitis B and C negative
children.content: The source is Hepatitis B and C negative

children.node: No follow-up warranted
children.content: No follow-up is warranted
